#Text=Sell a Used Boat
#Text=There are many facets to consider and tips to follow in order for you to sell your boat for the right price .
#Text=A crucial aspect of used boat selling is exposure .
#Text=If no one is aware your boat is for sale , you will most likely not sell it .
#Text=The market for used boats is vast because boating is a huge enterprise in the United States .
#Text=Use these used boat selling tips to help guide you through the process .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Assess the boat 's condition .
#Text=Determine if the boat operates .
#Text=Start up the motor ( if it 's a motorized boat ) and make sure it floats .
#Text=The standard of used boats range dramatically .
#Text=Some used boats are sold in perfect condition ; others hardly run at all .
#Text=Selling a used boat that is in working condition is much easier than selling a poor-quality boat .
#Text=Check for surface damage .
#Text=A boat can run just fine but be plagued with dents and scratches from use .
#Text=Some of the superficial issues can be fixed prior to sale , but it 's important to get a full account of the boat 's problems .
#Text=Decide whether to repair the boat or sell it as is .
#Text=Hire a professional to perform boat repairs or fix minor damage yourself .
#Text=If the damage is extensive , you might not want to put too much money into repairs before you have found a buyer .
#Text=Otherwise , you might end up paying more money to repair the boat then you will make off its sale .
#Text=Clean the boat thoroughly .
#Text=Scrub the boat from bow to stern .
#Text=If there is considerable grime , you might consider renting a power washer .
#Text=A brand new boat would be hard to sell if it were dirty , so cleaning your used boat until it shines is key to selling it .
#Text=Take flattering photographs of your boat .
#Text=Snap photos from all angles for buyers who are n't located near you .
#Text=The more photos and the higher quality of photos you have of your boat , the more likely you are to attract a buyer .
#Text=Determine a price .
#Text=Browse the Internet for similar used boats being sold .
#Text=Use the official NADA guide ( http://www.nadaguides.com/Boats?nozip=1&nopop=1 ) for another price quote .
#Text=Have your boat appraised by a professional to discover its worth .
#Text=List your boat on online sites .
#Text=Write a detailed description of the boat that contains the following information :

#Text=when the boat was purchased , special features on the boat , when extra features were installed , price paid for the boat new and price for the special features , any and all maintenance records .
#Text=Use proper spelling and grammar when writing your description .
#Text=List the boat on multiple sites , including sites specifically for used boats and sites for the selling of all items ( eBay , Craigslist ) .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Let potential buyers examine and test-drive your used boat .
#Text=Include your contact information when listing your boat .
#Text=If a buyer cannot get a hold of you , he or she will not buy your used boat .
#Text=If your boat is worth more than $ 50,000 , consider hiring a professional broker to sell your boat .
#Text=He or she will take a 10 to 15 percent commission , but you are more likely to receive a good price for the boat .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Always practice honesty when selling a used boat .
#Text=Do not attempt to mislead potential buyers .
#Text=A used boat that has been in salt water will sell for less than freshwater boats .
